cr.title: American River Pump Station Project Transfer Act of 2007
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, on that I demand the yeas and nays.

cr.title: Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act, 2008
cr.topics: Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act, 2008: PARLIAMENTARY INQUIRY
cr.excerpt: Mr. Chairman, I move to strike the last word. Mr. Chairman, I listened to the remarks of the gentleman, and I think he had some good points to make, but I do just want to point out that under the Republicans, the Democrat minority was allowed to determine which of their projects got funded. If Democrat projects were stripped out, it wasn't...

cr.title: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker. I am deeply disappointed that the final version of H.R. 6, passed today by the House, did not contain a reauthorization of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act, which compensates counties for the large amounts of land the Federal Government took from them to create the National Forest System. This loss of...

cr.title: Authorizing the Use of The Capitol Grounds For the Greater Washington Soap Box Derby
cr.excerpt: Madam Speaker, I have watched over the years on energy what has been happening in this country. Now we are in a big mess, with gasoline prices over $4 a gallon. This didn't just happen by accident; the Democrats have been working to make this happen for the 18 years that I have been a Member of this House. Very interesting. You know, ANWR...

cr.title: Iraq War Resolution
cr.topics: Iraq War Resolution: THE WAY FORWARD--A NEW APPROACH
cr.excerpt: Madam Speaker, five and a half years ago, our Nation was attacked by terrorists opposed to freedom and individual liberty. Our President vowed to keep Americans safe by taking the fight to the terrorists, and holding the regimes that support them accountable. We are currently engaged in that fight. Like any war this size, mistakes have been...
